text: Question 2 @{e1\[c} There are 6 jobs with distinct difficulty levels, and 3 computers with distinct processing speeds. Each job is assigned to a computer such that: The fastest computer gets the toughest job and the slowest computer gets the easiest job. Every computer gets at least one job. The number of ways in which this can be done is . Q- X J 65 0- GATE CSE 2021 SET-1 Discrete Mathematics
